page.title: 14Belstead Pumping Station
page.content:
Belstead pumping station is supplying Chantry and some of the Belstead area. It has three bore holes which go down 100m. The water level is 20m. and the pump goes down 30m. Every hour 500,000 litres can be pumped from the bore holes. When the water comes out it is aerated. Then it is purified. Then a little bit of chlorine is added to kill germs. In Ipswich altogether there is 50,000 litres stored. Six years ago there had to be a man at the station to work. Now the pumps are worked by computer. Downing C.P. School.
Note: There has been concern about the high level of nitrates in local water supplies due to agricultural fertiliz- ers. Water rates are considered high in relation to the rest of the country, especially where quality is concerned.
